Name: A cabinet for older New Yorkers
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to a cabinet for older New Yorkers

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Aging

Summary: This bill would codify a Cabinet for Older New Yorkers, made up of the commissioners of city agencies or their designees and chaired by the commissioner of the Department for the Aging. The cabinet would facilitate inter-agency collaboration to improve services for older New Yorkers. The commissioner of the Department for the Aging would be required to report to the Council and the public on the activity of the Cabinet.

Be it enacted by the Council as follows:\ulnone\par

\pard\ltrpar\fi720\sl480\slmult1\qj Section 1. Chapter 66 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new section 2405 to read as follows: \par
\ul\'a7 2405. Cabinet for older New Yorkers. a. Definitions. For the purposes of this section, the term \ldblquote mayor\rquote s office for people with disabilities\rdblquote  means the office established under executive order number 17 for the year 1990 or any successor office or agency that carries out the same or substantially similar functions. \par
b. Cabinet. There shall be a cabinet for older New Yorkers. The cabinet shall meet at least once every 6 months. \par
c. Duties. The cabinet shall facilitate coordination across agencies to further the elimination of age-related barriers and inequities in the provision of services to older adults and review current and future initiatives to ensure that they are inclusive of older adults. \par
d. Members. The cabinet shall be composed of the following members, or their designees: \par
1. Commissioner for the aging, who shall serve as chair;\par
2. Commissioner of information technology and telecommunications;\par
3. Chair of the civic engagement commission; \par
4. Commissioner of cultural affairs; \par
5. Commissioner of health and mental hygiene; \par
6. Commissioner of housing preservation and development;  \par
7. Commissioner of parks and recreation; \par
8. Commissioner of social services;\par
9. Commissioner of transportation; \par
10. Commissioner of youth and community development; \par
11. Director of the office of immigrant affairs; \par
12. Director of the mayor's office for people with disabilities; and\par
13. Commissioner of veterans\rquote  services. \par
e. Required invitations. The commissioner for the aging shall also invite to participate in the work of the cabinet the following persons, or their designees: \par
1. Chancellor of the city school district of the city of New York; \par
2. Chief executive officer of the New York city health and hospitals corporation; and\par
3. Chief executive officer of the New York city housing authority. \par
f. Optional invitations. The commissioner for the aging may also invite representatives of any other relevant federal, state or local agency to participate in the work of the cabinet. \par
g. Report. One year after the effective date of the local law that added this section and annually thereafter, the commissioner for the aging shall submit to the speaker of the council and post on the website of the department a report on the work of the cabinet. Such report shall include but need not be limited to:\par
1. Actions taken or proposed as a result of the meeting of the cabinet; \par
2. Attendance at cabinet meetings, and \par
3. Minutes of cabinet meetings.  \par
\pard\ltrpar\qj\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect immediately. \fs18\par
